Best outfit planning apps

It's Friday night, and you just got home from work. You have a hot date in 45 minutes. You're already running late, and you have absolutely no clue what you should wear. Sounds horrifying, right? This scenario is all too common, especially for those who own a lot of clothes. Incorporating an outfit planning app can give your mornings, evening plans, and more a welcomed sense of ease. If you could use some simplicity in your life — and added free time — here are eight outfit planning apps to aid your schedule and boost your well-being:

1. Smart Closet

Smart Closet is a mobile app that enables you to catalog all your clothes to create an electronic wardrobe. How does it work? Simple. You upload images of your clothes using your smartphone camera or an image from the internet. Once you have uploaded your clothing items, you can create a collage for inspiration. You can also create an outfit by rule, like tops + jeans, and the app will generate all possible looks based on your closet. Smart Closet shows you statistics about your clothes in your profile, such as favorite colors and most worn looks.

2. Stylicious

Stylicious is a mobile and tablet app that allows you to organize your entire wardrobe and sort items by tops, bottoms, shoes, and accessories. You can experiment with different outfit combinations by sliding horizontal strips of items to form outfits. Stylicious also enables you to synch outfits to your LookBook. What's more, you can keep track of the number of times you've worn outfits.

3. Stylebook

Stylebook is a mobile app where you can create a virtual closet that contains all your real-life clothes. You can upload images of your clothes, separate them into customized categories, and create outfits for different occasions. You can also save your favorite looks. Stylebook is excellent for frequent travelers, too. It enables you to create a packing list where you can choose different outfits you want to take on your trip. Stylebook will then generate a list of all those items you need to pack.

4. Cladwell

Cladwell is a mobile app that you can use to give yourself a complete style makeover. You start by setting goals, such as “find my style” or “declutter my wardrobe.” The app asks you to select your 15 favorite items from your closet by uploading a picture to create your first capsule. Cladwell will recommend ensembles daily for the outfits based on the selected capsule and the weather. You can also plan outfits for different days.

5. GlamOutfit

GlamOutfit is a mobile app that helps you organize your closet digitally, find style inspiration from others, and plan what you're going to wear. If you're looking to dress for a specific occasion, you can request help from other users — they can access your digital wardrobe and create outfit suggestions for you.

6. Pureple Outfit Planner

Think of this mobile app like Tinder but for fashion. Pureple Outfit Planner allows you to catalog all your clothing items digitally. You can then create your own outfits or ask the app to generate an outfit recommendation for you automatically. If you don't like the outfit recommendation, you swipe left. If you love it, swipe right to save it.

7. Save Your Wardrobe

Save Your Wardrobe is an outfit planning app that’s focused on sustainability. Every time you upload a clothing item, you unlock your sustainability record. This app also allows you to plan outfits, and you can save them to a list, such as for traveling. Moreover, there is a services section to book repairs, cleaning, or donations to ensure clothing items don’t go to waste.

8. Closfy

Closfy, a mobile app, allows you to upload your whole wardrobe and organize your clothes by garment type, season, or utilities. You can also organize your outfits on the built-in calendar, which allows you to add up to three looks per day. Closfy provides tips on improving your fashion sense and appearance, too, based on your body type and skin tone.

Look more stylish, be more organized

An outfit planning app can save you time if you're a serious fashionista with a busy schedule. Not only will you look more stylish all the time, but you'll also learn how to become more organized. This means you'll never be late again to important events because you're scrounging through your closet to decide what to wear. Hello, peace of mind! When it comes to fashion these days, it's all about embracing technology.
